content.description: Ascend the crack/dihedral to the roof.  At the roof, make an interesting traverse right, clip the bolt at the top of Feelin' Green and then continue traversing to the fist crack at the top of Irreconcilable Differences.  Finish at the Irreconcilable Differences anchor.
content.protection: Pro from thin to 2".  2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Starts in the dihedral between Pidgeon Holer and Irreconcilable Differences, just left of Feelin' Green.

content.description: This is a splitter fist/offwidth crack in a right facing corner.  It would be much more difficult if it didn't have the opposite corner to stem off of for most of the height.  The rock making up the offwidth (90% of the climb) is very good, but after the crack ends you need to make a couple easy but committing face moves on less than inspiring rock.
content.protection: You could place as many #4 camalots as you want.  Lacking multiple #4s, I was also able to find a place for a #5 about 1/3 the way up, and a #3 at the very top before the crack jogs left.  You can place a #0.75C4 in the horizontal before the face moves, but the rock is a bit hollow sounding...
content.location: Just to the left of "GW Love Peanut Butter"

climbs.name: Pigeon Holer
climbs.fa: Sandy Epeldi, John Laughlin, and Dan Smith - 1996

content.description: This climb ascends a crack that starts as finger tips, and gets progressively wider until you can get inside and make some awkward moves to the anchor.
content.protection: The wide part is protected by a bolt, so all you need is pro to 3".  2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Just right of GW Loves Peanut Butter.

content.description: This excellent route starts on a technical finger/hand crack to a small roof/bulge.  Pull the bulge on good but spaced hand jams.  Above the bulge, a final boulder problem to gain the anchors is protected by one bolt which may be difficult to clip for the short folks.
content.location: 50 feet left of the bolted line, Fairway to Heaven.

climbs.name: Irreconcilable Differences
climbs.fa: Sandy Epeldi, John Laughlin, and Dan Smith - 1996

content.description: Black cliffs crack climbing at its finest!  Don't miss the occasional feet that pop up on the aretes.
content.location: The obvious finger crack a short distance right of Fairway to Heaven.

content.description: Jam jam jug, jam jam jug . . . Keep repeating all the way to the top.  Great fun!  Finish up and right at the Pidgeon Holer anchors.
content.location: Starts just right of the splitter offwidth Piss & Vinegar, at some graffiti.

content.description:
In April 2014 a good portion of the Green Acres wall collapsed, unveiling this sweet finger crack. A few days later, I cleaned it out, pried off a few sketchy blocks and cleared off a belay platform, so now it's good to go.

Climb the sweet finger crack, placing gear from tricky jams. At the top of the crack, traverse left across big but pumpy holds to The Garden's anchors. It's not very tall but it definitely packs a punch!
content.protection: .3-#1 Camalot size cams. This route takes bomber gear including on the traverse to the anchor.
content.location: The finger crack a few feet to the right of The Garden. It's pretty much right where Fairway to Heaven used to be.

content.description: Finger Lock and Jam heaven!  Those with small hands will be rewarded on this sustained climb.  Excellent crack climbing and technical stemming.  The crack can feel a bit greasy on a hot day.
content.location: 15 feet left of the bolted line Fairway to Heaven

climbs.name: Feelin' Green
climbs.fa: Sandi Epeldi, Dan Smith, John Laughlin - 1996

content.description: From below this route looks thinner and harder than it actually is.  Climb the mossy pillar to a bolt, then traverse right and finish on the Irreconcilable Differences fist crack. As you climb, good incut edges, that were invisible from below, appear just where you need them.
content.protection: Protection is thin but reasonable below the bolt.  You may want to bring a #2 or #3 for the crack after the bolt.  2 bolt anchor.
content.location: The mossy green pillar just to the left of Irreconcilable Differences

content.description:
This route no longer exists, as this portion of the wall sloughed off from the main cliff body. Description here for historical purposes only.

Big moves to good holds up the outside of a slightly overhanging pillar.
content.location: Right in the middle of Green Acres.
